triples.name: Constraint programming
triples.relevance: The paper applies constraint programming as the foundational paradigm for solving combinatorial problems.

triples.name: Q-learning
triples.relevance: Deep Q-learning is used as the core machine learning algorithm to learn the value-selection heuristic.

triples.name: Graph neural network
triples.relevance: Heterogeneous graph neural networks are used to represent and process constraint problems.

triples.name: Graph coloring
triples.relevance: Graph coloring is one of the benchmark combinatorial problems used to evaluate the proposed framework.

triples.name: Independent set (graph theory)
triples.relevance: Maximum independent set is one of the benchmark problems used to test the framework's performance.

triples.name: Maximum cut
triples.relevance: Maximum cut is one of the combinatorial optimization problems used in the experimental evaluation.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning is the overarching methodology used to automatically learn the value-selection heuristic.

triples.name: Combinatorial optimization
triples.relevance: Combinatorial optimization is the general problem domain that constraint programming solves.

triples.name: Heuristic (computer science)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel generic value-selection heuristic learned through deep Q-learning and graph neural networks.
